newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..
newsitem.headline: Canada daily lumber export figures to U.S..

text.p: Canada softwood lumber exports to the United States as of 0001 EDT on Aug 19 in board feet, according to data from the Canadian Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade:
For the July 1 - September 30 quarter
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 1.68 mln 0.25 million 0.002 million 4.68 million 6.61 million
EB 1.108 bln 151.16 million 208.55 million 451.69 million 1.920 bln
LFB 0.48 mln 0.09 million 0.04 million 0.80 million 1.41 million
UFB 0.44 mln 0.08 million 0.14 million 0.19 million 0.86 million
Total 1.111 bln 151.58 million 208.73 million 457.36 million 1.929 bln
Pct exported: EB - 13.06 LFB - 0.21
For the April 1 - June 30 quarter:
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 10.96 mln 4.14 million 7.26 million 44.75 million 67.11 million
EB 2.300 bln 305.11 million 409.73 million 940.64 million 3.956 bln
LFB 73.93 mln 24.54 million 20.19 million 12.76 million 131.42 million
UFB 3.16 mln 7.05 million 8.48 million 2.94 million 21.63 million
Total 2.389 bln 340.84 million 445.66 million 1.001 bln 4.176 bln
Pct exported: EB - 26.91 LFB - 20.21
Total year to date (April 1 1997 to present)
Province BC Alberta Ontario Quebec Total
bonus 12.64 mln 4.39 million 7.26 million 49.43 million 73.72 million
EB 3.409 bln 456.27 million 618.28 million 1.392 bln 5.876 bln
LFB 74.41 mln 24.64 million 20.23 million 13.56 million 132.84 million
UFB 3.60 mln 7.13 million 8.61 million 3.13 million 22.48 million
Total 3.500 bln 492.42 million 654.39 million 1.458 bln 6.105 bln
Pct exported: EB - 39.97 LFB - 20.43
Source: Export and Import Controls Bureau, Department of Foreign Affairs and International Trade.
NOTE: EB = established base shipments, LFB = lower fee base, UFB = upper base fee.

From April 1, 1997, Canadian lumber exports which exceed quarterly or annual quotas are subject to export fees. Exports above 14.7 billion board feet annually or 4.226 billion board feet quarterly are subject to US$50 fee for every 1,000 board feet. If such excess exports exceed 650 million board feet, they are subject to a US$100 fee for every 1,000 board feet.
Export quotas are allocated for each province on a company-by-company basis. Shippers who have not been given an allocation are subject to the US$100 fee for any lumber they export.
This export data is based on Canadian export permits. There is about a one-week lag between the entry of lumber into the United States and the application for a Canadian permit.
((Reuters Ottawa Bureau (613) 235-6745))
